questions.question: What is the purpose of a data visualisation?

choices.answer: To display graphs without words
To display data and words in a graphic
To display and explain information
To display charts, animations and images

questions.question: Which of the following is an aspect of a ‘dynamic data visualisation’.

choices.answer: The appearance of the infographic does not  change.
A poster with graphics
An interactive display of the latest data
The data has been updated to present the latest   information available.﻿

questions.question: A comprehensive file management plan will

choices.answer: describe how to destroy hard drives.
describe how electronic document files will be  handled.
explain how to install applications.
explain how to search and discover where files  are kept.

questions.question: Transferring a file from a network onto a USB drive, so that only one copy of the file exists is known as

choices.answer: archiving
metadata
backing up
synchronising.

questions.question: To permanently erase a file from a hard drive

choices.answer: move the file to recycle/trash, then empty trash.
the data must be overwritten with 0s and 1s.
the hard drive must be removed and physically  disabled or destroyed.
save over the file with another file that has the  same name.

questions.question: During which stage of the PSM are evaluation criteria developed?

choices.answer: Analysis
Design
Development
Evaluation

questions.question: What is the purpose of the evaluation stage of the PSM?

choices.answer: To check if input data is reasonable
To check if the solution is working correctly
To check if the solution is meeting the needs of the users
To allow the project staff to have a break after the development is done
time and persistence.
a test table.
beta testers.
a test strategy and suitable test data.
